author: Diego Guadalupe
title: Por quÃ© Bitcoin y Ethereum terminarÃ¡n 2023 con fuerza
text: Por quÃ© Bitcoin y Ethereum terminarÃ¡n 2023 con fuerza - La acciÃ³n del precio de BTC y ETH este aÃ±o fue una de las mejores del siglo. - BTC mostrÃ³ debilidad, lo que sugiere una caÃ­da por debajo de $43,000, mientras que ETH puede avanzar hacia $2,500. [Bitcoins [BTC]](https://ambcrypto.com/search/bitcoin) y [Etereum [ETH]](https://ambcrypto.com/search/ethereum) Las actuaciones en 2023 pasarÃ­an a ser consideradas una de las mejores de la historia del siglo, segÃºn revelÃ³ una publicaciÃ³n de Santiment. Al momento de esta publicaciÃ³n, BTC habÃ­a podido recuperar $43,000. ETH, en el otro extremo, se disparÃ³ y cambiÃ³ de manos a 2.380 dÃ³lares. La herramienta de anÃ¡lisis criptogrÃ¡fico, en su publicaciÃ³n, tambiÃ©n mencionÃ³ que ETH y BTC poseen la capacidad de alcanzar sus valores mÃ¡s altos antes de que termine el aÃ±o. ðŸ¥³ðŸ“Š 2023 estÃ¡ pasando a los libros como uno de los aÃ±os de mejor desempeÃ±o del siglo, representando mÃºltiples sectores importantes. [#Bitcoin]y [#Etereum]todavÃ­a estÃ¡n al alcance de superar los mÃ¡ximos de mÃ¡s de 1,5 aÃ±os, que se establecieron hace apenas 3 semanas. [https://t.co/JxbW5vU5Iy] [pic.twitter.com/aLSGX5U2Vv] â€“ Sentimiento (@santimentfeed) [27 de diciembre de 2023] DespuÃ©s del brillo, viene la fiesta. A principios de aÃ±o, el mercado de las criptomonedas estaba luchando por recuperarse del colapso de FTX que hizo caer los precios. Durante ese tiempo, el valor de BTC era inferior a 17.000 dÃ³lares, mientras que ETH cotizaba un poco por encima de 1.200 dÃ³lares. El ascenso de Bitcoin y Ethereum fue impulsado por diferentes razones. Pero alrededor del primer trimestre (Q1), la razÃ³n principal fue el colapso de algunas de las principales instituciones tradicionales en los EE.UU. El colapso de los bancos en ese momento desencadenÃ³ desconfianza en las instituciones. A su vez, el mercado de criptomonedas liderado por Ethereum y Bitcoin se beneficiÃ³ de la liquidez retirada, ya que tambiÃ©n afectÃ³ en buena medida a los precios. Si bien hubo otras razones para el continuo aumento de precios, la influencia notable que ha mantenido a ambas monedas en el lado verde es el optimismo en torno a un [potencial](https://ambcrypto.com/grayscale-files-revised-application-for-bitcoin-spot-etf-details-here/) ETF al contado. Durante la mayor parte del aÃ±o, varias empresas han solicitado un ETF de Ethereum o Bitcoin. En unos pocos casos, algunas empresas solicitaron ambos. Estas solicitudes, a pesar de haber sido retrasadas por la SEC estadounidense, influyeron en las entradas de inversiones. En muchas ocasiones, AMBCrypto [revelado](https://ambcrypto.com/crypto-fund-inflows-surpass-2022-numbers-in-6-weeks/) Aumentos en el dinero que fluye hacia productos de inversiÃ³n conectados a Bitcoin y Ethereum. Las entradas indicaron que varias instituciones confiaban en el desempeÃ±o a corto y largo plazo de las criptomonedas. Por lo tanto, no fue sorprendente que BTC registrara un aumento del 159% en lo que va del aÃ±o (YTD). ETH tambiÃ©n siguiÃ³ subiendo un 98%. En los Ãºltimos dÃ­as, hay predicciones de que las monedas podrÃ­an terminar el aÃ±o aÃºn mejor. Alcistas y osos se apresurarÃ¡n por el gran premio Para Bitcoin, el grÃ¡fico diario mostrÃ³ que habÃ­a un fuerte soporte en $42,279. Sin embargo, el soporte en el nivel no fue una confirmaciÃ³n de una tendencia alcista. AMBCrypto evaluÃ³ la divergencia de convergencia de media mÃ³vil (MACD), que fue negativa. El MACD negativo indicÃ³ un creciente impulso bajista. AdemÃ¡s, el Ã­ndice de fuerza relativa (RSI) confirmÃ³ el sesgo cuando la lectura cayÃ³ a 54,52. Si esta tendencia continÃºa, Bitcoin podrÃ­a terminar el aÃ±o por debajo de los 43.000 dÃ³lares. Sin embargo, el grÃ¡fico anterior tambiÃ©n muestra el volumen en equilibrio (OBV) que estaba aumentando. El aumento del OBV refleja una presiÃ³n de volumen positiva que podrÃ­a conducir a precios mÃ¡s altos. Si la presiÃ³n de compra aumenta justo antes de que termine el aÃ±o, BTC podrÃ­a alcanzar los 45.000 dÃ³lares. Si no, un [hacia abajo](https://ambcrypto.com/is-bitcoin-due-for-a-price-correction/) moverse por debajo de $ 43,000 podrÃ­a ser su prÃ³ximo objetivo. Mientras tanto, el grÃ¡fico de 4 horas del ETH/USD refleja una estructura alcista. El 27 de diciembre, ETH habÃ­a superado la resistencia de 2290 dÃ³lares. Pero el precio de la moneda enfrentÃ³ un rÃ¡pido rechazo despuÃ©s de alcanzar los $2,415, lo que sugiere que habÃ­a un grupo de acumulaciÃ³n en ese nivel. Aunque la volatilidad aumentÃ³, la banda superior de las Bandas de Bollinger (BB) alcanzÃ³ el precio de ETH. Esto sugiere que la altcoin estaba sobrecomprada y el precio puede retroceder aÃºn mÃ¡s. Pero al observar el Ãndice de Movimiento Direccional (DMI), la historia fue diferente. Realista o no, aquÃ­ estÃ¡ [La capitalizaciÃ³n de mercado de ETH en tÃ©rminos de BTC](https://ambcrypto.com/calculator/marketcap) En el momento de esta ediciÃ³n, el +DMI (verde) era 33,92 mientras que el -DMI (rojo) era 16,35. Esta posiciÃ³n implicaba que las tendencias alcistas de ETH seguÃ­an siendo presiÃ³n. Si el Ã­ndice direccional promedio (ADX), de color amarillo, permanece por encima de 25 mientras el +DMI supera el -DMI, entonces ETH puede volver a probar $2,415 o [saltar](https://ambcrypto.com/ethereum-why-a-big-eth-move-to-2-5k-might-be-imminent/) a $2,500 antes de que cierre el aÃ±o.

author: PA News Agency
title: Sharp rise in religious hate crimes recorded by UKâ€™s largest police forces | Lancashire Telegraph
text:
The number of antisemitic hate crimes recorded by many of the UKâ€™s largest police forces jumped sharply in the weeks following the outbreak of the Hamas-Israel conflict, new figures reveal.
Islamophobic offences also rose for some forces, although the picture was more mixed across the country.
Jewish charities called the findings â€œshockingâ€, while campaigners against anti-Muslim abuse said the data was â€œdeeply worryingâ€.
The Home Office condemned the rise in offences, adding: â€œThere is no place for hate in our society.â€
(PA Graphics) The figures have been obtained by the PA news agency using Freedom of Information requests. They show that:
â€“ Greater Manchester Police recorded 74 antisemitic offences in the month following the Hamas attacks on Israel on October 7, compared with 15 for the same period in 2022 and 14 in 2021, while West Yorkshire Police recorded 53, compared with 10 (2022) and 14 (2021).
â€“ West Midlands Police recorded 22 antisemitic offences from October 7 to November 7, compared with one (2022) and eight (2021), while Merseyside Police recorded 20 compared with four (both 2022 and 2021).
â€“ The British Transport Police had one of the largest increases, recording 87 antisemitic offences in the month after October 7, up from eight in the same period in 2022 and 11 in 2021, as well as a jump in Islamophobic offences with 22 (2023), up from two (2022) and eight (2021).
â€“ West Yorkshire recorded 49 Islamophobic offences in this period in 2023, up from 29 (2022) and 38 (2021), but the pattern was not so clear for Greater Manchester (34 in 2023, 43 in 2022 and 42 in 2021) or West Midlands (25 in 2023, 33 in 2022 and 23 in 2021).
(PA Graphics) The Community Security Trust described the figures as â€œshockingâ€ and said they made clear â€œthe extent of the unacceptable rise in anti-Jewish hatred across the country since the Hamas terror attack on October 7â€.
A spokesman for the Jewish charity said: â€œThis wave of antisemitism was triggered by the mass murder, rape and kidnapping of Jews in Israel, and is fuelled and sustained by extremist hatred online and on our streets.
â€œIt is essential that perpetrators are identified and prosecuted, and that wider society shows its disgust for this racist hate crime.â€
Tell Mama, which monitors and works to tackle anti-Muslim sentiment and abuse in the UK, told PA that â€œlevels of anti-Muslim hatred and discrimination are deeply worrying, impacting trust in authorities and their sense of identity and belongingâ€.
Iman Atta, the organisationâ€™s director, said there had been a â€œsignificant spike in anti-Muslim hate since the atrocities on October 7â€, adding: â€œThe nature of many offline cases sent to our service is often overtly racist â€“ targeting Arab and Palestinian communities with dehumanising slurs, anti-Muslim slurs or in some cases targeting their homes, or when speaking Arabic in public, as well as targeting Muslim communities across all ages and gender.
â€œWe should never allow such hatred and intolerance to take root in our communities and at this time, please look out for each other, whether Muslim or Jewish. We must stand together against intolerance, hate and racism.â€
The Metropolitan Police, the largest force in the UK, said delays prevented it from supplying full figures until the new year, but it had previously reported 218 antisemitic and 101 Islamophobic offences between October 1 and 18 this year, compared with 15 and 42 respectively in the same period in 2022.
PA obtained full responses from 31 of the 46 forces across the UK, with the data representing a snapshot of what has currently been recorded by forces and is therefore subject to change.
Methods for recording hate crime are not consistent across forces, so the data cannot be used to compare the number of offences between different areas or provide an overall total for the whole of the UK.
But the figures do point to a jump in antisemitic offences recorded by forces concentrated mostly in cities or across built-up areas, while the pattern for Islamophobic offences was more varied.
(PA Graphics) Some forces that operate across a mix of urban and less populated areas tend to show a similar pattern, although with lower volumes of offences â€“ for example Hertfordshire Police (17 antisemitic offences for the period in 2023, compared with six in 2022 and three in 2021) and Thames Valley Police (21 antisemitic offences in 2023, one in 2022 and four in 2021).
Data obtained from smaller forces, or those covering areas with few towns or cities, typically showed low numbers of offences, often in single figures, meaning a clear trend was hard to determine.
A spokesman for the Board of Deputies of British Jews said the findings â€œprovide further evidence of the huge upsurge in antisemitism following the Hamas massacre of October 7â€.
The board, seen as the voice of the British Jewish community with over 300 deputies directly elected by the synagogues and communal organisations they represent, told PA the rise in antisemitism had â€œcaused enormous anxiety for Jewish people, particularly children and Jewish students on campus or indeed anyone easily identified as Jewish by their dressâ€.
A spokesman added: â€œWe call on police to take strong action against anyone found to be perpetrating hate crimes.â€
The Muslim Council of Britain said: â€œDespite the extremely low reporting rate from Muslim communities, the huge increase in Islamophobic hate crimes recorded with the police reflects what we are seeing from third-party reporting groups.
â€œThe Governmentâ€™s laissez-faire attitude to Islamophobia contrasts strongly with its no-tolerance approach to antisemitism. We are hopeful this will now change.â€
A spokesperson for the Home Office said: â€œThere is no place for hate in our society and we condemn the recent rise in reported antisemitic and anti-Muslim hatred.
â€œWe expect the police to fully investigate all hate crimes and work with the CPS to make sure the cowards who commit these abhorrent offences feel the full force of the law.
â€œFollowing recent events, we have also made further funding available to Jewish and Muslim communities, to provide additional security at places of worship and faith schools.â€

organizations.name: pa news agency using freedom of information

author: Nareerat Wiriyapong
title: Bangkok Post - Baht expected to dive on US data
text: The baht could slide further, touching 36 to the dollar if US economic data released later this week indicates a resilient US economy and further delays to the Federal Reserve's trim of interest rates, says Kasikorn Research Center (K-Research). Weaker results than expected for the Thai economy have prompted continued capital outflows, noted the think tank. The Thai currency traded at 35.76-78 against the greenback on Thursday morning, sliding from Wednesday's close of 35.68 after the US Manufacturing and Services Purchasing Managers' Indices for January posted the highest levels in 15 months and seven months, respectively. The baht fell to a two-month low of 35.88 to the dollar during trade on Wednesday. "Signs of resilient manufacturing and service sectors in the US support the probability that the Fed will keep the rate at high levels for longer as inflation is still higher than the central bank's target," said Kanjana Chockpisansin, head of research at K-Research. The think tank projects the US central bank will start cutting the rate in the second quarter this year at the soonest, she said. Meanwhile, the outlook for the Thai economy remains fragile and lacks fundamental factors to drive growth, said Ms Kanjana. As of Jan 24, fund outflows from the Thai stock market totalled 23.9 billion baht year-to-date, while foreign investors sold 5.9 billion baht worth of Thai bonds, she said. "If US GDP and inflation figures due this week are strong, the baht could possibly fall to below 36 to the dollar," Ms Kanjana told the Bangkok Post. SCB Financial Markets said the baht has been supported by a stronger yuan as Beijing ramps up stimulus measures, with the People's Bank of China preparing to cut the reserve requirement ratio (RRR) for commercial banks. The agency estimates the baht will move in a range of 35.65-90. Ms Kanjana, however, believes the US factors will have a more profound impact on the baht's movement. "The RRR measure is something the market has expected for some time. The Chinese government has clearly stated it will do so as the economy needs a boost," she said. "Once the Chinese economy shows clear signs of a recovery, then the yuan and other currencies in the region should strengthen."

organizations.name: us manufacturing and services purchasing managers

author: ANTHEE CARASSAVA
title: Greece Faces Growing Labour Shortage Amid Surging Job Vacancies
text: A recent report from the Hellenic Statistical Authority (ELSTAT) has revealed a significant increase in job vacancies in [Greece](https://www.iefimerida.gr/tag/greece), raising concerns about the country's labor market. According to the report, the number of job vacancies surged by 58.8% in the second quarter of 2024 compared to the same period last year. This marked a significant acceleration from the previous year's growth rate of 36.2%. The rise in job vacancies has become a major challenge for the Greek economy, hindering its growth potential. Despite the country's overall economic expansion, the labour shortage has emerged as a significant bottleneck. The Bank of Greece Governor, Yannis Stournaras, has warned that the situation could worsen if immediate steps are not taken to address the shortage. He estimated that there are currently around 200,000 vacant positions in the Greek labour market. The labour shortage is likely due to a combination of factors, including demographic changes, increased economic activity, and competition from other countries for skilled workers. To address the issue, the Greek government may need to implement policies to encourage immigration, improve education and training, and create a more flexible labour market. author: @rtesport
title: 'It's mistakes, isn't it?' - Topping sums up Irish loss
text:
Ireland head coach James Topping was left to bemoan a series of errors as the team's quest for silverware in the Sevens competition came to an end in a 19-15 loss to defending champions Fiji at the Stade de France on Thursday night.
Topping's troops were seeded to play a side with a perfect Olympic winning streak of 16, which stretches back to the introduction of the sport at Rio 2016, after coming up just short against New Zealand.
There were parallels between both performances, with the wayward boot of Mark Roche evident once more. The scrum-half missed all three of his conversions attempts in the team's second loss of the day, while a number of handling errors also served to sabotage the podium hopes of a side second in the world rankings.
Topping had little doubt over how the game was decided, telling RTÃ‰ Sport after the final whistle in Paris: "It's mistakes, isn't it? It's a game of errors, Sevens, as opposed to 15-a-side where there might not be many errors.
"We had a couple of kick-offs and we missed one of them. Ball hits the ground and they pick it up and that's what Fiji do - they're very good off scraps.
"We tried to control the ball and keep possession, but if the ball hits the ground or is a bit loose, those guys are all over it and that's the game they play. They can just pick the ball up and they're gone, they've all got such individual talent.
"It's tough, we can only do it for so long. We're going to maybe make three or four mistakes in the game and Fiji have the ability to score off all those mistakes.
"We maybe struggled on that side of it the way we play, but as you can see by the scoreline we still put them under pressure."
We need your consent to load this comcast-player content We use comcast-player to manage extra content that can set cookies on your device and collect data about your activity. Please review their details and accept them to load the content. Manage Preferences
A shot at the medals may have ended, but Ireland must now switch their focus to the fifth to eighth place play-offs, where the United States will be their initial opponents, before a clash against either New Zealand or Argentina.
Topping insists that those games carry merit in their own right, particularly for players set to step away from the sport or retire altogether.
"We have a day off tomorrow, which isn't great to have. We'd like to get it finished now, but there are a few of our players who will be moving on and retiring from the game, at least for a bit," he added.
"We want to go and get that fifth place and give those guys who are going two great matches that they can remember because it's a fantastic stadium and a fantastic occasion to play in."
Despite his brace of tries against Fiji, Chay Mullins ended up on the losing side and admitted his bitter disappointment had left him almost speechless.
"We'll have to look back on it as an opportunity missed," the Bristol-born player said. "It's not every day you get to go to an Olympics and losing in a quarter-final... I'm kind of last for words, to be honest.
"I thought we controlled the game very well in the first half and there were parts of the second half where we controlled it very well again.
"Their tries, that's just how Fiji play. You've got to control it and we didn't."
Mullins echoed the sentiments of his head coach in how Ireland would now address Saturday's double-header, adding: "We did have higher hopes than how we finished here, but we still have two games on Saturday.
"We've still got those opportunities and there are lads here who might not be here next year and we just want to finish on a high as a group."
Watch the 2024 Olympic Games with 14 hours of televised action on RTÃ‰2 and RTÃ‰ Player each day. Listen to extensive radio coverage on RTÃ‰ Radio 1 and 2fm's Game On and follow each moment from Paris on RTÃ‰.ie, the RTÃ‰ News app and all RTÃ‰ digital platforms. Listen to the daily RTÃ‰ Sport Olympics Podcast.

author: MarketScreener
title: Yulia Navalnaya demands authorities release husband's body, calls Putin's faith 'fake' -February 24, 2024 at 03:09 am EST | MarketScreener
text:
(Reuters) - Yulia Navalnaya, the widow of the late Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny, on Saturday demanded that Russian authorities release his body for burial and accused a "demonic" Russian President Vladimir Putin of "torturing" his corpse.
In a six minute video posted on YouTube, Navalnaya accused Putin of holding her husband's body "hostage", and questioned Putin's often-professed Christian faith.
Navalny's mother Lyudmila said on Friday that Russian investigators were refusing to release his body from a morgue in the remote Arctic city of Salekhard until she agreed to lay him to rest without a public funeral.
She said an official had told her that she should agree to their demands, as Navalny's body was already decomposing.
On Saturday, Navalny aides said that authorities had threatened to bury him in the remote prison colony where he died unless his family agreed to their conditions.
In the video, an emotional Yulia Navalnaya claimed that Putin personally was responsible for the whereabouts of Navalny's body, and that he was "torturing" Navalny in death as he had in life.
"We already knew that Putin's faith was fake. But now we see it more clearly than ever before," said Navalnaya, dressed in black.
"No true Christian could ever do what Putin is now doing with Alexei's body."
Since returning to the Russian presidency in 2012, Vladimir Putin has positioned himself as a defender of traditional, conservative values against what he portrays as corrosive Western liberalism.
He has also trumpeted his closeness to Russia's Orthodox Church, regularly appearing at services around religious festivals, and speaking of his personal faith.
Navalnaya said her husband had been a devout Christian, who attended church and had fasted for Lent even while in prison. She said his political activism had been inspired by Christian values.
Concluding her video, she said: "Give us back the body of my husband. We want to hold a funeral service and bury him in a humane way, in the ground, as is customary in Orthodox Christianity."
(Reporting by Felix Light; Editing by Tomasz Janowski)
Share Â© Reuters - 2024

author: Digna Irene Urrea
title: Opena IA lanza GPT-4.5, menos alucinaciones mÃ¡s coherencia y con "coeficiente emocional"
text:
El lanzamiento de GPT-4.5 marca un avance significativo en inteligencia artificial, mejorando la precisiÃ³n, la interacciÃ³n y la comprensiÃ³n del lenguaje. A diferencia de su predecesor, este modelo optimiza el aprendizaje no supervisado y afina su capacidad para interpretar intenciones humanas , reduciendo errores y sesgos. Â¿Es una revoluciÃ³n o solo una mejora incremental? En este anÃ¡lisis, exploramos sus aplicaciones, impacto y limitaciones.
Una de las principales mejoras de GPT-4.5 es su mayor precisiÃ³n en la generaciÃ³n de respuestas, como lo demuestran las pruebas de SimpleQA. Con una precisiÃ³n del 62.5%, supera a GPT-4o y otros modelos previos, mientras que su tasa de alucinaciones se ha reducido significativamente al 37.1%. Estas mejoras son el resultado de una arquitectura optimizada y una base de datos de entrenamiento mÃ¡s robusta, lo que le permite generar respuestas mÃ¡s fidedignas.
Sin embargo, el modelo no es infalible. A pesar de la reducciÃ³n en errores, sigue presentando limitaciones en preguntas especÃ­ficas y en razonamiento complejo, especialmente en temas de lÃ³gica avanzada y matemÃ¡ticas. Aunque supera a versiones anteriores en interpretaciÃ³n del lenguaje, aÃºn hay margen de mejora en su capacidad de argumentaciÃ³n profunda.
Te puede interesar: Google lanza Gemini Code Assist gratis, Â¿cÃ³mo acceder a esta poderosa herramienta para programadores? Uno de los aspectos mÃ¡s innovadores de GPT-4.5 es su mayor â€œcoeficiente emocionalâ€. La interacciÃ³n con los usuarios es ahora mÃ¡s natural, con respuestas que reflejan mejor el contexto emocional. Este rasgo es particularmente Ãºtil en aplicaciones de asistencia psicolÃ³gica, coaching personal y educaciÃ³n personalizada, donde la comprensiÃ³n del tono y la intenciÃ³n es fundamental.
No obstante, esta mayor empatÃ­a tambiÃ©n plantea desafÃ­os Ã©ticos. A medida que la IA se vuelve mÃ¡s convincente y â€œhumanaâ€, aumenta el riesgo de dependencia emocional por parte de los usuarios. AdemÃ¡s, la interpretaciÃ³n subjetiva de emociones podrÃ­a generar respuestas sesgadas en ciertos contextos sensibles.
Aplicaciones GPT-4.5 tiene varias aplicaciones en la vida real y en nuestras tareas diarias, por ejemplo, en escritura y ediciÃ³n de contenido, ofrece sugerencias precisas para mejorar textos, mientras que en programaciÃ³n ha optimizado la generaciÃ³n y correcciÃ³n de cÃ³digo en flujos de trabajo complejos.
En el Ã¡mbito educativo, proporciona explicaciones detalladas y adapta su enseÃ±anza al nivel del usuario. AdemÃ¡s, es una herramienta eficaz para la exploraciÃ³n e investigaciÃ³n, facilitando la bÃºsqueda de informaciÃ³n precisa en diversas disciplinas.Sin embargo, su mayor capacidad computacional tambiÃ©n implica un mayor costo de uso, lo que podrÃ­a limitar su accesibilidad para ciertos usuarios o pequeÃ±as empresas.
Si bien el nuevo modelo es mÃ¡s avanzado en aprendizaje no supervisado, aÃºn no alcanza niveles de razonamiento comparable al humano. OpenAI reconoce que el siguiente paso en la evoluciÃ³n de la IA serÃ¡ integrar modelos con mayor capacidad de pensamiento estructurado y abstracciÃ³n.
GPT-4.5 representa una evoluciÃ³n significativa en la generaciÃ³n de lenguaje, con una mayor precisiÃ³n, mejor comprensiÃ³n emocional y mÃ¡s aplicaciones prÃ¡cticas. No obstante, sus limitaciones en razonamiento complejo y su alto costo indican que aÃºn queda camino por recorrer.
Imagen: Generada con IA
